p: The results and the conclusions regarding monsoon can also change depending on the selection of the domain 14 15. To ensure robustness of our results, we have considered five domains that encompass relatively small case of CIM as well as larger domain that also includes parts of Indian Ocean ( Fig. 1). As expected, there are small differences among the seasonal mean rainfall and the trends for different domains even in observations ( Fig. 1); however, the values are generally consistent. We note that for D5 (continental India plus ocean) the trends are opposite for 1951–2005 and 1951–1975; however, this could be a manifestation of low-frequency variability. For our discussion, it is important to note that both CMIP3 and CMIP5 (all) ensemble reproduce the current (1976–2005) trends within the margin of acceptability ( Fig. 1).
